result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul J. Schleis was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul J. Schleis

11:00 AM DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF56, 16CF46, 18CF84 and states appearances. Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared in custody with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states on 18CF84 recommendations and motions court to amend charge to Misd Battery 940.19(1). Court questions parties on 18CF84 if plea and sentencing will be completed today. Both parties give comments. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive its reading. On 18CF84 DE enters plea of GUILTY to amended count 1. Court grants motion by the State to amend Ct. 1 on 18CF84.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC amended Ct.1 on 18CF84. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive its reading. On cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF56, 16CF46, Recommendations and comments by DA.  Comments by Atty Fehrenbach. Comments by DE. Summation by Court.

Court Imposes:

15CF45 
Ct. 2
1 year Jail with Huber and is consecutive to any other sentence in being. - DE is given 183 plus additional 173 days jail credit then remaining credit to go to 15CF46 (9 days)
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 

15CF46
Ct. 3
6 Months Jail with Huber and is consecutive to 1yr and any other sentence in being. - DE is given 32 days jail credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 

15CF56
Ct. 2
3 Months Jail with Huber and is consecutive to any other sentence in being. - DE is given 30 days jail credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 

16CF46
Ct. 2
160 days Jail with Huber and is consecutive to any other sentence in being. - DE is given 12 days jail credit
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 

18CF84
30 Days Jail with Huber and is consecutive to any other sentence in being. - DE is given 7 days jail credit
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
$300 Fine
$200 DNAAS

Appeal Rights Given

Days Credit Worksheet
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 10, 2019 at 11:00 am.

11:01 am - Court calls case and DA states appearances.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared with attorney Diane Carol Lowe.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement reached.  On motion of DA, Court dismisses Cts 1 & 3.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 2.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2.  Court imposes:

Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$2135 fine.  DE to set up pay plan with probation.
14 days jail with huber and is to commence 4/5/18.  Court is not opposed to furlough request.
27 month DL revocation
27 month IID
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: of Preliminary Examination
DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

3:29 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan files waiver of preliminary.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  Atty Morgan questions court regarding days credit on a number of the DE's cases.  Court states DE does not get jail credit for charges that are dismissed.  Court advises Atty Morgan as to filing a written motion to withdraw his plea.
Waiver of Prelim on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

2:16 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan appearing by speakerphone.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion by DE and Atty Morgan.  To be rescheduled.
Waiver of Prelim on March 1, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on March 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

1:15 pm - DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF47, 15CF51, 15CF56, 15CF57, 16CF42, 16CF43 and 16CF46, states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The DA moves to amend 15CF56 from Felony to Misd. bail jumping.  So ordered.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.   Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire form.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.  DE admits to 15CF47, 16CF42, 16CF43, along with uncharged PPD 15-895, and PRSO16-1240 for purposes of restitution and service fees.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO. On motion of state, court dismisses Ct 1 on 15CF45, Cts 1 &2 on 15CF46, 15CF51, both counts in 15CF57.

Court imposes:
15CF45 Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $250 DNAAS, 6 months jail with huber (cs) with 1 day credit for time served, psycho-sexual assessment, followthrough and treatment, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, AODA and followthrough with any recommendation.  Separately from probation, Sex offender registry is ordered DE's lifetime.

15CF46 Ct 3 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 court costs, $200 DNAAS, $25 restitution + $2.50 surcharge for a total of $27.50, 30 days jail with huber (cs), with credit for 1 day served.  AODA and followthrough with any recommendation

Amended 15CF56 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $200 DNAAS, $65 SBDA, 30 days jail with huber (cs), AODA and followthrough with any recommendation, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, along with costs on Dismissed but read in costs on 15CF47 - $45 SBDA, 16CF42 - $65 SBDA, 16CF43 $115.50 blood draw fee to PPD.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE not operate a motor vehicle unless he/she has a valid dl in their possession.  DE must maintain absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle.

Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
